metadata.titel_preek: A Christian Word For Tough Times

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher uses the metaphor of the 'good soldier' to address the reality of suffering and 'tough times.' He provides anecdotal evidence from college campuses and historical/biblical references to the Roman military and the book of Revelation.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The focus is more on the illustration of the soldier than a deep linguistic exegesis of the Greek 'kakopatheson'. It functions as a thematic springboard.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force is primarily ASSERTIVE (describing the human condition and God's sovereignty) with a shift toward EXPRESSIVE (joy/enthusiasm) and a final move toward COMMISSIVE (God's victory).
voorbeelden: There are tough times for all of us.
Our Commander is the Lord of hosts.
The New Testament uses many figures...

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To encourage the hearer to endure hardship by looking at the ultimate victory of Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly acknowledged in the prayer: 'Lord, send your spirit upon all of our churches.'

voorbeelden: Smith is one of the big four of women's education.
The New Testament uses many figures.
Our Commander is a mighty good leader.
Thou therefore endure hardness.
We need to be done with bored indifference.
Take up the sword of the Spirit.
I was overwhelmed.
How can a preacher not grow tired?
It is good to see a growing atmosphere of enthusiasm.
God will keep that case open.
Jesus shall reign.
Nothing is ever settled until it is settled right.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly eschatological, but often framed as a general truth rather than a direct address to the specific hearer's current pain.

voorbeelden: Shake somebody! Save somebody!
March on, my soul.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses petitionary prayer as a declarative-adjacent act, but rarely speaks 'in persona Christi' to the hearer.

indicatoren: Extensive anecdotal storytelling about Smith College.
General descriptions of 'the middle-aged man' or 'the teenager' (3rd person).
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a lecture on 'tough times' rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Specific sacramental promise to the 'you' in the pew
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration at a distance; the hearer feels 'encouraged' but not necessarily 're-created'.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The promises are largely eschatological and collective ('God will settle it right') rather than personal and immediate.
voorbeelden: God will keep that case open.
He gives us a mighty, strong armor.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Homiletical 'we' and personal anecdotes ('I preached at...').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Very low. Mostly in the opening scripture quote or general 'you' in the armor section.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Weak. Used more for illustration than address.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Talking about 'the soldier', 'the student', 'the enemy', 'the Commander'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'theatre' effect where the hearer watches a drama rather than being addressed by the King.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about life and God's nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The closing vision and the prayer 'Shake somebody'.

voorbeelden: There are tough times... Thou therefore endure.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The imperative to 'endure' precedes the performative word of grace, making it a moral burden.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God is strong) -> Commissive (He will settle it) -> Directive (March on).
voorbeelden: Our Commander is the Lord of hosts... march on, my soul.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern emerges late in the sermon, providing a strong finish.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Our Commander is a mighty good leader... Take up the sword.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: We need to be done with bored indifference (without a preceding declarative of grace).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a high-quality theological lecture on the sovereignty of God in suffering. It describes the 'event' of God's victory but rarely 'performs' that victory for the hearer in the moment.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The wind does not move in 'the tops of the mulberry tree'.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The middle-aged man... is having a tough problem.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Objectifies the hearer's pain instead of addressing it.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a 'talk about' an event (the victory of Christ) rather than being the event itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The lack of direct address (2nd person) and declarative force limits its sacramental impact.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is spoken about as a 'Commander' in the 3rd person.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts more as a witness/reporter than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: John says he saw the end of it all.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher asks the Spirit to 'shake' people, acknowledging the effect is not his own.
tekstueel_bewijs: Lord, send your spirit upon all of our churches.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Implicitly, but the language is more rhetorical than sacramental.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Low until the final section on Revelation.
tekstueel_bewijs: Our Captain is King of kings.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense 'was/found' and 3rd-person 'is'. Needs more 2nd-person 'gives/promises/forgives'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The good soldier of Christ Jesus knows that he is not in some impromptu, private battle.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: You, soldier of Christ, are not alone in this battle; your Commander stands with you now.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a direct address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is located in the future or in a story about John/Martin Luther King.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Bring the promise into the 'Now' of the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who are weeping today, Christ promises: I have not closed your case.
You who are nearing retirement and wondering...

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: Generally well-balanced, but the indicative needs more performative weight.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ensure the 'indicative' is a 'declaration' not just a 'description'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant and theologically sound, but it remains a 'report' from the front lines rather than the 'voice' of the Commander himself. Increasing direct address will turn this lecture into an event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about his trip to Smith; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' authority of the Word to change the hearer's status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric praises the 'mulberry tree' imagery; SAT asks if that imagery carries the 'illocutionary force' of a divine promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that despite the 'enthusiasm' described, the sermon's grammatical structure is largely distancing (constative surplus).

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Our Commander is the Lord of hosts.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Provides a foundation but lacks direct impact.
High; the most 'event-like' moment in the text.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'talking about' God's power rather than 'handing over' God's power.
